stepAnswer: So, reading a(G(r)) from left to right,a(G(r))=acceleration of the gravitational force for a planet from a distance r from the sun.
stepTitle: The gravitational force on a planet a distance $$r$$ from the sun is given by the function G(r). The acceleration of a planet subjected to any force F is given by the function a(F). Form a meaninful composition of these $$2$$ functions, and explain what it means.
answerLatex: So, reading a(G(r)) from left to $$right, a(G(r))=acceleration$$ of the gravitational force for a planet from a distance $$r$$ from the sun.
